intro: Goeppertia sericea, commonly known as the silver arrow plant, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Marantaceae family and is characterized by its striking, silver-green, velvety leaves. The plant typically grows as an upright perennial, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its foliage is often used in ornamental horticulture for its aesthetic appeal. Goeppertia sericea prefers bright, indirect light and consistently moist, well-draining soil.
